subject: chemistry
title: Main Group Metals Reactions MCQ Problems

problems.question: Which general equation describes how an alkali metal (M) reacts with water?
problems.hint: Alkali metals form hydroxide and hydrogen gas when reacting with water.
problems.detailed: Alkali metals lose one electron to form \(\ce{M+}\). Reaction with water gives hydroxide and hydrogen gas: \(\ce{2M + 2H2O -> 2MOH + H2}\). Thus option B is correct.
problems.author: Cabir Abassov

problems.question: Which statement is true about the reactivity of alkali metals as you go down the group?
options: They no longer react with oxygen
problems.hint: Larger atoms lose electrons more easily.
problems.detailed: As you go down Group 1, the outer electron is further from the nucleus and more easily lost. This makes the metals more reactive down the group.
problems.author: Cabir Abassov

problems.question: What products form when a metal reacts with a dilute acid, provided the metal is above hydrogen in the reactivity series?
problems.hint: An example reaction is \(\ce{Fe + 2HCl -> FeCl2 + H2}\).
problems.detailed: A reactive metal displaces hydrogen from the acid, producing a salt and hydrogen gas: \(\ce{M + 2HCl -> MCl2 + H2}\). Thus option B is correct.
problems.author: Cabir Abassov

problems.question: What happens to a metal oxide when it dissolves in water (for many main group metals)?
problems.hint: Most metal oxides are basic in nature.
problems.detailed: Many main group metal oxides dissolve in water to form metal hydroxides. For example: \(\ce{Na2O + H2O -> 2NaOH}\). These solutions are basic (alkaline).
problems.author: Cabir Abassov

problems.question: What is the reactivity of metals like copper, silver, and gold toward dilute acids or water?
problems.hint: These metals are low in the reactivity series.
problems.detailed: Copper, silver, and gold are much less reactive than hydrogen. Therefore, they do not displace hydrogen from acids or react with water under normal conditions. They are largely unreactive in these cases.
problems.author: Cabir Abassov
